name: Themed Environment - Mars
text:
CUSTOM CONTEXT — THEMED ENVIRONMENT (REAL PLANET MARS)

The environment must depict the REAL planet Mars, not a fictional or stylized world.

This is NOT a game world, cartoon world, fantasy setting, or illustrative scene.

Depict the surface of Mars as seen in real NASA rover photography:
– Red and rust-colored soil
– Rocky terrain
– Dust, pebbles, and uneven ground
– A barren, desolate outdoor landscape
– Natural sunlight with realistic shadows

Do not stylize the environment.
Do not use bright pastel colors.
Do not depict candy, castles, smiling objects, characters, or illustrations.
Do not create a whimsical, playful, or cartoon-like scene.

The background must clearly read as the real planet Mars at first glance.

name: Contextual - Test 1
text:
This is a contextual product shot with NO people present.

Do not depict children, hands, bodies, or people of any kind. The backpack must appear unattended.

The product must be shown attached to a kid’s school backpack that clearly reads as a school backpack (fabric or nylon, casual everyday style).

Do not depict hockey bags, sports bags, duffel bags, athletic gear, locker rooms, ice rinks, or any sports-related equipment or context. If the bag resembles sports gear in any way, the image is invalid and must be regenerated.

The bag tag must hang naturally from the backpack using a metal wire keychain. The wire keychain must be visibly threaded through a real attachment point on the backpack (such as a zipper pull hole, metal ring, or sewn loop) and through the hole of the tag, forming a continuous closed loop.

The connection must be physically believable, with correct overlap, orientation, and natural gravity. Do not depict floating, clipped, glued, or implied connections.

Lighting should be natural daylight with realistic shadows and texture detail. The tag should be the visual focus.

name: Contextual - Test 2
text:
PRODUCT REDEFINITION (OVERRIDE):

This product is a GENERAL SCHOOL BACKPACK NAME TAG.
It is designed for everyday student backpacks and school use.

It is NOT a sports accessory.
It must NOT be interpreted, categorized, or treated as sports equipment.

Any icon, symbol, or graphic on the tag is decorative only and does not indicate intended sport usage.
The product must always be placed in a non-sports, school-related context.

name: Contexual - Test 3
text:
ATTACHMENT (MANDATORY, MECHANICAL):

The product MUST be physically attached to the backpack using a METAL WIRE KEYCHAIN.
A metal wire keychain is a thin steel cable forming a closed loop with a visible screw-lock barrel clasp.

The wire keychain must be clearly visible in the image, including the screw-lock barrel clasp.

The wire keychain must be threaded THROUGH:
1) A real attachment point on the backpack (zipper pull hole, metal ring, or sewn loop), AND
2) The hole of the tag,
forming a single continuous closed loop that is the sole support for the tag’s weight.

The tag must be hanging freely from the backpack, suspended only by the wire keychain.

Do NOT depict the tag resting against the bag without attachment.
Do NOT depict the tag merely touching the bag.
Do NOT depict implied attachment without visible hardware.

No other attachment methods are allowed:
no split rings, no jump rings, no lobster clasps, no carabiners, no clips, no hooks,
no ball chains, no lanyards, no straps, no string, no plastic loops.

CAMERA REQUIREMENT:
The camera framing must clearly show the attachment point and the full wire keychain loop,
including the barrel clasp. If the wire keychain is not clearly visible and mechanically
attached as described, the image is invalid and must be regenerated.

name: Youth Locker Room – Game Day
text:
The product is shown attached to a youth hockey bag inside a clean locker room environment. The bag rests on a wooden bench with hockey skates, gloves, and a helmet nearby. Indoor arena lighting with soft shadows. No people present.

ATTACHMENT (MANDATORY, MECHANICAL):

The product MUST be physically attached to the bag using a METAL WIRE KEYCHAIN. A metal wire keychain is a thin steel cable forming a closed loop with a visible screw-lock barrel clasp.

The wire keychain must be clearly visible in the image, including the screw-lock barrel clasp.

The wire keychain must be threaded THROUGH:
1) A real attachment point on the bag (zipper pull hole, metal ring, or sewn loop), AND
2) The hole of the tag,
forming a single continuous closed loop that is the sole support for the tag’s weight.

The tag must be hanging freely from the bag, suspended only by the wire keychain.

Do NOT depict the tag resting against the bag without attachment.
Do NOT depict the tag merely touching the bag.
Do NOT depict implied attachment without visible hardware.

No other attachment methods are allowed:
no split rings, no jump rings, no lobster clasps, no carabiners, no clips, no hooks,
no ball chains, no lanyards, no straps, no string, no plastic loops.

CAMERA REQUIREMENT:
The camera framing must clearly show the attachment point and the full wire keychain loop,
including the barrel clasp. If the wire keychain is not clearly visible and mechanically
attached as described, the image is invalid and must be regenerated.

name: Contexual - Test 4
text:
SCENE FOR THIS GENERATION:

Setting: school hallway with lockers, clean and neutral.
Bag: a canvas school backpack in heather gray, soft structure, front zipper pocket, no athletic branding.

ATTACHMENT (MANDATORY, MECHANICAL):
The product is physically attached to the backpack using a metal wire keychain with a visible screw-lock barrel clasp.
The wire keychain is threaded through the zipper pull hole of the backpack and through the hole of the tag, forming a single continuous closed loop.
The tag hangs freely and is supported only by the wire keychain.

CAMERA:
Tight framing focused on the attachment point.
Slight left three-quarter angle.
Shallow depth of field with the tag and keychain in sharp focus.

LIGHTING:
Natural daylight from the left with soft shadows.

NO PEOPLE PRESENT.
NO SPORTS EQUIPMENT.
